translation: Somewhere the lioness was causing her milk to be sucked by the calves;

gurmukhi: khUM isMG lY sMg gaUAwN crwvY ]
transliteration: Kahoon Singh Lai San Gadoaan Charaavai||
translation: Somewhere the lion was grazing a herd of cows,
At that place the snake was creeping without ire;
Somewhere the learned Pundit was praising the enemy in his discourse.13.284.

gurmukhi: qQw sqR im`qRM qQw imqR sqRM ]
transliteration: Tathaa Satra Mittran Tathaa Mitra Satran||
translation: The enemy and the friend and the enemy are alike;

gurmukhi: jQw eyk C`qRI qQw prm CqRM ]
translation: An ordinary Kshatriya and a universal are alike.

gurmukhi: qhw gXo AjY isMG sUrw su kRu`DM ]
transliteration: Tahaa Gado Ajai Singh Sooraa Su Kruddhan||
translation: In that place of (of Sanaudhi Brahmin) went the warrior Ajai Singh in great rage,
Who wanted to kill Asumedh in a fierce war.14.285.

gurmukhi: rjIAw puqR idiKE fry duie BRwqM ]
transliteration: Rajeea Poutra Dikhio Dare Due Bhraatan||
translation: Both the brothers were frightened on seeing the son of the maid-servant.

gurmukhi: ghI srx ib`pM builE eyv bwqM ]
translation: They took shelter of the Brahmin and said:

gurmukhi: guvw hym srbM imly pRwn dwnM ]
transliteration: Guvaa Hem Saraban Mile Praan Daanan||
translation: “Save our life, thou shalt receive the gift of cows and gold from the lord;
“O Guru, we are in thy shelter, we are in thy shelter, we are in thy sgelter.”15.286.
The king (Ajai Singh) sent his messengers (to king Tilak) and (Sanaudhi Brahmin).
